text: William Morton Kahan (born June 5, 1933) is a Canadian mathematician and computer scientist. He received the Turing Award in 1989 for "his fundamental contributions to numerical analysis." He was named an ACM Fellow in 1994, and added to the National Academy of Engineering in 2005. ==Other websites== * William Kahan's home page * portrait picture of Kahan (on page 5) * Paranoia for modern graphics processing units (GPUs) * Paranoia source code in multiple languages * IEEE 1985. IEEE standard for binary floating-point arithmetic. ACM SIGPLAN Notices 22, 2 (Feb.), 9-25 * An Interview with the Old Man of Floating-Point, 1998-Feb-20 * A Conversation with William Kahan, Dr. Dobb's Journal November, 1997 Category:Turing Award winners Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian computer scientists Category:Scientists from Toronto Category:University of Toronto alumni Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty
title: William Kahan
